l4/sys/semaphore

00001 // vi:ft=cpp
00002 /*
00003  * \file
00004  * \brief   User-Level Semaphores.
00005  * \ingroup l4_sem_api
00006  */
00007 /*
00008  * (c) 2008-2009 Adam Lackorzynski <adam@os.inf.tu-dresden.de>,
00009  *               Alexander Warg <warg@os.inf.tu-dresden.de>
00010  *     economic rights: Technische Universit√§t Dresden (Germany)
00011  *

00013  * GNU General Public License 2.
00014  * Please see the COPYING-GPL-2 file for details.
00015  *

00017  * library without restriction.  Specifically, if other files instantiate
00018  * templates or use macros or inline functions from this file, or you compile
00019  * this file and link it with other files to produce an executable, this
00020  * file does not by itself cause the resulting executable to be covered by
00021  * the GNU General Public License.  This exception does not however
00022  * invalidate any other reasons why the executable file might be covered by
00023  * the GNU General Public License.
00024  */
00025 
00026 #pragma once
00027 
00028 #include <l4/sys/semaphore.h>
00029 #include <l4/sys/capability>
00030 
00031 namespace L4 {
00032 
00033 /*
00034  * \ingroup l4_sem_api
00035  * \brief Kernel pert of the fast user semaphore.
00036  *
00037  * <c>\#include <l4/sys/semaphore></c>
00038  *
00039  * \see L4::Semaphore for the full sempahore class.
00040  */
00041 class K_semaphore : public Kobject
00042 {
00043 protected:
00044   K_semaphore();
00045 
00046 public:
00047   /*
00048    * \brief return codes of the down operation.
00049    */
00050   enum Returncode
00051   {
00052     OK      = 0, 
00053     TIMEOUT = 2, 
00054     INVALID = 3  
00055   };
00056 
00057   long down(l4_u_semaphore_t *sem, l4_timeout_s timeout) throw()
00058   { return l4_error(l4_usem_down_to(cap(), sem, timeout)); }
00059   long down(l4_u_semaphore_t *sem) throw()
00060   { return l4_error(l4_usem_down(cap(), sem)); }
00061   long up(l4_u_semaphore_t *sem) throw()
00062   { return l4_error(l4_usem_up(cap(), sem)); }
00063 };
00064 
00065 /*
00066  * \ingroup l4_sem_api
00067  * \brief Fast user-level semaphore.
00068  * 
00069  * <c>\#include <l4/sys/semaphore></c>
00070  * 
00071  * This is a fast user-level semaphore implementation. It can be used
00072  * for all kinds of synchronization and is well optimized for the
00073  * non-contention case.
00074  */
00075 class Semaphore
00076 {
00077 private:
00078   l4_u_semaphore_t _u;
00079   Cap<K_semaphore> _k;
00080 
00081 public:
00082   /*
00083    * \brief Return codes for the down operations.
00084    */
00085   enum Returncode
00086   {
00087     OK      = K_semaphore::OK,      
00088     TIMEOUT = K_semaphore::TIMEOUT, 
00089     INVALID = K_semaphore::INVALID, 
00090   };
00091 
00092 
00093   /*
00094    * \brief Create a new semaphore.
00095    * \param k the capability selector for the kernel part of the semaphore.
00096    *
00097    * The kernel part must be allocated separately (see L4::Factory,
00098    * \ref l4_factory_api). You can also initialize the capability and
00099    * the counter value later by using one of the init() methods.
00100    */
00101   Semaphore(Cap<K_semaphore> const &k = Cap<K_semaphore>::Invalid) : _k(k)
00102   { _u.counter = 0; _u.flags = 0; }
00103 
00104   /*
00105    * \brief Initialize the semaphore object.
00106    * \param cnt the initial counter value (>0 means free, <=0 means blocked).
00107    * \param k   the capability for the kernel object related to that semaphore.
00108    */
00109   void init(long cnt, Cap<K_semaphore> const &k)
00110   { _k = k; _u.counter = cnt; _u.flags = 0; }
00111 
00112   /*
00113    * \brief Initialize the semaphore object.
00114    * \param cnt the initial counter value (>0 means free, <=0 means blocked).
00115    */
00116   void init(long cnt)
00117   { _u.counter = cnt; _u.flags = 0; }
00118 
00119   /*
00120    * \brief Do a down operation on the semaphore, with a timeout for blocking.
00121    * \param timeout the timeout to use when the operation blocks.
00122    * \return #OK on success, #TIMEOUT or #INVALID on failure.
00123    *
00124    * \note This operation will block if the counter is 0 or less.
00125    * \note To implement a try-lock semantics use a relative timeout of 0, this
00126    *       shall immediately return in either case and the return value
00127    *       indicates if the operation succeeded.
00128    */
00129   long down(l4_timeout_s timeout) throw()
00130   { return _k->down(&_u, timeout); }
00131 
00132   /*
00133    * \brief Do a down operation on the semaphore.
00134    * \return #OK on success, #INVALID on failure.
00135    *
00136    * \note This operation will block if the counter is 0 or less.
00137    */
00138   long down() throw()
00139   { return _k->down(&_u); }
00140 
00141   /*
00142    * \brief Do an up operation on the semaphore.
00143    *
00144    * \note This operation shall wakeup possibly blocked threads.
00145    */
00146   long up() throw()
00147   { return _k->up(&_u); }
00148 
00149   /*
00150    * \brief Get the capability for the kernel part.
00151    */
00152   Cap<K_semaphore> ksem_cap() const { return _k; }
00153 };
00154 
00155 }
L4Re - L4 Runtime Environment
